Description: Upper part of pottery plaque with figure of a woman (Aphrodite?) wearing a wig, in high relief holding goat (antelope?) by the legs. Almond shaped eyes and lids visible. Mould-made plaque, pressed into single piece mould. Coated with a yellow slip, possibly painted pink. Red-brown Nile silt with black core. Organic silt with abundant vesicles, mica, quartz, uncommon grog and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by The Petrie Museum of Egyptian Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Some doubt in the register about the provenance, appears to be assigned to Naukratis Sanctuary of Aphrodite on the basis of a poor parallel. A very close parallel was found at Tanis (Brissaud 1995, 29, Fig.2a). Brissaud, P. 1995, Rapport sur la campagne de printemps Avril - Mai 1995, BSFFT 9, 7-37.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DC.029) (Phase 3)
